com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors

Class PropertyRenderingViewProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.EntityViewProcessorAdapter
      • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.processors.PropertyRenderingViewProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntityViewProcessor

    @Component
 @Exposed
 @Scope(value="prototype")
public class PropertyRenderingViewProcessor
extends EntityViewProcessorAdapter
    Renders one or more registered properties from the EntityPropertyRegistry attached to the EntityViewContext. Control names generated by these elements will be prefixed as they are expected to represent entity properties.

    This processor will first create a Map holding the descriptors for all properties requested. This will happen during initializeCommandObject(EntityViewRequest, EntityViewCommand, WebDataBinder).

    During createViewElementBuilders(EntityViewRequest, EntityView, ViewElementBuilderMap) a ViewElementBuilderMap instances will be created for the set of property descriptors. This map will be available under the attribute ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_BUILDERS in the EntityView. Following processors can update the builder collection.

    During render(EntityViewRequest, EntityView, ContainerViewElementBuilderSupport, ViewElementBuilderMap, ViewElementBuilderContext), the actual ViewElements will get created and added to the container. If the global builderMap contains a builder named ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTIES_CONTAINER_BUILDER the elements will get added to that builder, else they will get added to the root container passed as argument.

    This processor will prefix the control names of all properties having an EntityAttributes.NATIVE_PROPERTY_DESCRIPTOR attribute.

    Other processors that want to modify either the descriptors or builders collection, can use one of the static methods to get the right collection:

    • propertyDescriptors(EntityView)
    • propertyDescriptors(EntityViewRequest)
    • propertyBuilders(EntityView)
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Field Detail

      • ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_DESCRIPTORS

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_DESCRIPTORS
        Contains the Map of property descriptors that were used to create the initial collection of ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_BUILDERS. Added during initializeCommandObject(EntityViewRequest, EntityViewCommand, WebDataBinder) and can be modified by other processors. This processor will use the actual value during createViewElementBuilders(EntityViewRequest, EntityView, ViewElementBuilderMap).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_BUILDERS

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_BUILDERS
        Contains the Map of ViewElementBuilder for the properties that have been rendered. Unless manually modified, the keys will always correspond to the keys of the ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_DESCRIPTORS collection. Set during createViewElementBuilders(EntityViewRequest, EntityView, ViewElementBuilderMap), the actual value is used during render(EntityViewRequest, EntityView, ContainerViewElementBuilderSupport, ViewElementBuilderMap, ViewElementBuilderContext).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTIES_CONTAINER_BUILDER

        public static final String ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTIES_CONTAINER_BUILDER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setSelector

        public void setSelector(EntityPropertySelector selector)
        Define the properties that should be rendered. Defaults to all readable properties. A new selector will be combined with the default. If the new selector defines the EntityPropertySelector.CONFIGURED property, the selector will be considered an extension of the previously registered selector.

        public static Map<String,EntityPropertyDescriptor> propertyDescriptors(@NonNull

        Parameters:

      • propertyBuilders

        public static ViewElementBuilderMap propertyBuilders(@NonNull
                                                     @NonNull EntityView entityView)
        Retrieve the ViewElementBuilderMap containing the registered ViewElementBuilder instances by property name. One is usually created automatically based on the propertyDescriptors(EntityView) result during the createViewElementBuilders(EntityViewRequest, EntityView, ViewElementBuilderMap), but if none is present one will get created when calling this method.

        Conditionally checking if there is one should be done using entityView.hasAttribute( PropertyRenderingViewProcessor.ATTRIBUTE_PROPERTY_BUILDERS ) instead.

        Parameters:
        entityView - onto which to register the builders
        Returns:
        builder map where the key is the property name, never null

      • setViewElementMode

        public void setViewElementMode(ViewElementMode viewElementMode)
        Which type of view elements should be created for the properties?
